title: 3 injured in midtown shooting
content:
Police responded to the shooting around 5:30 p.m. near East 20th Street and South Lakewood Avenue. While en route, officers stopped a white Pontiac matching the description of the suspects' vehicle and found two black males, ages 20 and 19, in the vehicle who had been shot multiple times. (KTUL)
TULSA, Okla. (KTUL) — Three people were taken to the hospital after a New Year's Eve shooting in midtown.
Police responded to the shooting around 5:30 p.m. near East 20th Street and South Lakewood Avenue. While en route, officers stopped a white Pontiac matching the description of the suspects' vehicle and found two black males, ages 20 and 19, in the vehicle who had been shot multiple times.
Officers went to a nearby barber shop on East 21st Street and found a 16-year-old Hispanic male who had been shot. All three were taken to the hospital with non-life threatening injuries, according to police.
While it's not yet clear what happened, police say a group of Hispanic males went to the barber shop before one or more of them went to meet up with a group of black males near 20th and Lakewood. Two or more people pulled out guns and shot at the other group, according to police.
Police recovered a handgun in the Pontiac.
